s0: ^The neon lights glimmer across the forecourt.
s1: ^The hum of your engine harmonises with the crickets.
s3: ^Crisp packets and cigarette butts crush beneath your feet.
s4: ^The prices seem to have gone up again.
s5: ^You forget for a moment whether your car takes diesel or unleaded.
s6: ^You get a bit of oil on your finger from the cap.
s7: ^The smell of the spilt oil on the ground is addicting, nostalgic.
s8: ^A newspaper catches flight and dances along the ground in front.
s9: ^You glance at the advertisments for jobs stuck to the window. It seems all these places have since closed down.
s10: ^The cashier hums a song that you can't quite remember.
s11: ^You consider the available snacks, but realise you probably can't afford any.

c-0: ^You fill the car up with gas.

s0: ^It shines like a beacon in the hopeless darkness.
s1: ^You can smell the grease from out in the car park.

c-0: ^You fill the car up with gas.
c-1: ^You check in to the small on-site hotel.

GREENHOUSE: ^A complex network of dome-shaped greenhouses appear abandoned, hidden behind trees.

c-0: ^It is humid inside the greenhouse. Long corridors are lined with moulding fruit trees, rotting wooden tables, plastic sheeting, ultraviolet lamps, disconnected pipes, puddles of water, bottles of fertiliser.
^Behind a glass wall is someone's office - messy- you can see some succulents in little pots, a gold scyth, a few jars of mushrooms.
^You look like those folks over at the Power Station.
^If you want me to join you, I'm already there.
^What I need from you first, though, is all the fuel you've got in your tank.
^Great. That's a lot of trust, friend. But thank you.
^While I'm with you, we won't need fuel.
^I might come in handy with any natural obstacles or things like that, I worship the Moss God so I get perks.

FOREST_ENTRANCE: ^The entrance to the forest is blocked by fallen trees that have become blanketed in Moss over time. Inside, you can see the forest is dark, ominous, but patches of light peak through the dense canopy.

c-0: ^The Druid clears the moss and rotting wood from the entrance to the forest.

BIG_TREE: ^An ancient tree, older than time itself, stands colossal on a hill, casting its proud shadow across the fields.
^It creaks and aches in the wind, bark peeling, battered, but still clinging on.
MOSS_SHRINE: ^A shrine to the Moss God rests, undisturbed, in a clearing dripping with old rainwater.
^An orb of green glows, sustained in the still air, above the mossy stone blocks, radiating light around the waxy leaves.
MOSS_PILLARS: ^Crumbling stone pillars are stained from exhaust emissions. Moss grows up the West-facing side.
CARVING: ^On the side of a slope a large section of moss has been scraped away. From a distance you can see that it spells out a word, but can't tell what it is.
STONE_SLAB: ^A stone slab, fragile to touch, hides under layers of thick moss. A carving in it reads:
BURNING_BUSH: ^A large clump of lichen seems to be on fire. A wiry stream of smoke cuts through the muggy air.
CAMPFIRE: ^The ash heap of an extinguished campfire is damp from the rain. Water drips from the leaves overhead.
^The camp seems to have been left in a hurry... half-empty bottles of beer, packets of crisps, backpacks, jackets. Any tracks left behind have been erased by the weather.

c-0: ^You find coordinates noted on a scrap of paper.
^They tell you to travel SOUTH WEST of the burning bush... Whatever that means.

CABIN: ^A log cabin hides among the pines and moss.
^Fire glow from the hearth behind the curtains lights the surrounding area orange, a porch with boots outside, an axe in a stump, a pile of logs, rocks, a large four wheel drive.

c-0: ^Who's there at this sort of time?

QUARRY: ^A quarry, vast, exposes the ground by the river.

s0: ^A hitchhiker walks along the side of the road, thumb outstretched, backpack, clutching a large two-handed sword that emits some kind of holy light.
s1: ^A backpack is abandoned at the side of the road.

c-0: ^Thank Mould! Finally someone responds to my thumb! Been walking this road for moons and moons.
^You folks are part of the uprising, right?
^So what's the deal? Are you heading out towards the coast? I've been trying to get to this cove down there... I can't remember the name.
^Those blasted wolves knocked out my memory cells when they jumped me! Damn dogs!
^If we could stop by that would be cool.

COVE: ^A discrete cove with white sands and a grey looping tide looks out onto the Lethe Sea.

b: ^This is the place. I can feel it. There's something here.
^The warrior walks down to the beach below.
^The warrior finds, embedded into the cliff, a moulding shrine. Spores and geometric fungus spreading across the old idol.
^Well, this isn't what I was remembering, but I suppose it will help.
^We'll need all the divine favour we can get up against the Darkness.

s1: ^The Mould God has nothing left for you here.

b: ^You don't notice anything remarkable about the place, but it is beautiful.
^A coastline corroding away into the water, perfect for a moment, before the erosion continues and wipes it all away.

CLIFF: ^A chalky path winds up the side of the cliff from the beach below. The ground around crumbles, rolls down, meets the ocean, is washed away.
LIGHTHOUSE: ^A red and white lighthouse is the tallest thing on the horizon, light beaming into the stormy waters.
MOTORWAY_BLOCKAGE: ^The motorway is blocked. Cars park across all the lanes, facing a projected image on a screen. Some kind of film showing?
^You can make out what looks to be somebody wandering about in a hotel room.

c-0: ^The person sits on the bed, gets up, goes to the bathroom, orders room service, has a drink from the minibar, brushes their teeth, watches TV, goes to sleep, wakes up, has a shower, has breakfast, and leaves.
^It keeps looping, and doesn't seem as though it will change.

PYLON: ^A pylon beast creeps around the frozen rock. Limbs creaking with metallic exhaustion. It has a gentle sigh.
^The wires connecting it to its friends fizz with potential energy.

c-0: ^You try to get the attention of the pylon beast, but it is preoccupied.
^You watch as it wanders away into the snowy distance.

PYLONS: ^Pylons and pipelines scar the landscapes, like a trail to remember where home is... where home was.
TV_WALL: ^A 4 by 4 stack of TVs is half burried in a snow drift.

^Through washes of static you can see fragments of a multichannel video piece. It depicts a group of people driving long distances in a small car, from different angles, cutting randomly between each shot.
SNOWMAN: ^A snowperson stands all alone in a field next to the road. They wear a smart hat, a scarf, smoke a pipe, and their carrot nose appears fresh.
^Rumour has it that just off the blabhalbah, by the blah a, there's a secret road that takes you to a hot spring.
^I would've check it out meself but... probably wouldn't be the best idea. Yknow?
STATIC_HOTSPRING: ^Clouds of steam emerge from a hotspring. The water bubbles and crackles, glowing energy, stained white rocks, specks of moss floating, hairs, a few people relaxing in the warm.

c-0: ^At first the water feels too hot, a shock to be out of the cold, but after a while you all become used the temperature.
^You relax, trying not to think about the darkness approaching, and, for a brief moment, feel at peace.

ICICLE: ^You peer into an icy cavern where you can see a radio has been frozen inside a stalactite. It emits bursts of sound.
^"It is going to keep snowing tonight!"
FROZEN_LAKE: ^A large flat-screen TV lies dormant beneath a frozen lake. The static texture on the screen makes the surface appear as if it is rippling, but it remains completely still.
FIRE: ^A lonesome traveller sits at a campfire with their dog and a backpack. They have gone blue from the cold and cry softly into their hands.

g-0: ^I dunno, yeah, not too bad. Can't complain.
g-1: ^I'm in search of the Static God.
^But to tell you the truth I'm quite lost.
^I heard that They were residing in the Forest of Moss at the moment but I searched the place and found nothing.
^Now I'm here at the Static Mountains, but I can't find anything here either.
g-2: ^I want this to be something I accomplish myself, but... I...
^Could you deliver this? To my family home.
^It's just a little letter I wrote, but it's really important to me.
^We live East of the mine, just off the A49.
^Thank you. I'll never forget this kindness.

NEWSAGENTS: ^What used to be a newsagents. It is pasted with newspapers, adverts, magazines so thickly that the door won't open.
CHIPPY: ^The familiar chippy smell is equally as strong as the cold smell of death and decay.
FIREQUEST: ^You realise it must be the family home of the traveller you met.

c-0: ^"We have a message from your child."
^We have a message from your child.
^The family member takes the note, and you notice them begin to cry as they close the door.
c-1: ^The family member takes the note, and you notice them begin to cry as they close the door.

SMALL_HOUSE: ^A small brick house, weathered from the wind. There are a few empty flower pots by the window.
FOREST_TEMPLE: ^A large geometric temple, covered in moss, gentle green glow - it beckons you.

c-0: ^You absorb the power of growth and life from the Moss God, who watches over, eyes glistening with love and pride.

COAST_TEMPLE: ^A large circular temple, covered in mould, gentle blue glow - it beckons you.

c-0: ^You absorb the power of death and decay from the Mould God, who watches over, smiling like a proud parent.

MOUNTAIN_TEMPLE: ^A large abstracted temple, glitching and spluttering with static glow - it beckons you.

c-0: ^You absorb the power of chaos and communication from the Static God, who watches over, flickering like a family member's ghost.

GLACIER: ^Up close to the glacier you can feel the pain of the ice as it melts gradually, and slides down the mountainside.
STATUE: ^A once-great statue of the Sand God crumbles, half collapsed. The powerful stature reduced to a fading notion of what it used to be.

c-0: ^Nothing seems to happen. This God must not be listening.

HOUSE_ON_RIVER: ^A small house with a thatched roof and a waterwheel is nested comfortably on the bank of the river among the reeds.
^Outside a blacksmith hammers at an anvil.

b: ^Hail and well met, travellers. What can I do for you?
^Ah good, one of you is well-versed in decay!
^I can help your standing with the Mould God if you bring me some ore. Create you some new weapons.
^There is a mine down South from here, you'll have to cross back over the river. You should be able to find some fungal ore there.
^Until then we have nothing to talk about.
^I'm afraid I don't think I'll be able to help you.
^You don't seem to have any members of your party who worship Decay.

CHOOSE_A_WEAPON: ^Would you take a look at that... beautiful tin.
^Haven't seen any so pure for so long!
^Beautiful. I'll make this up into a weapon for you immediately. What would you like?

g-0: ^That'll show those fucking fascists what for!

MINERS_HOUSE: ^A single miner's house remains where a cluster used to be. A large hole in the roof lets the rain in.

c-0: ^Who the blazes knocks on my door???
^Can you tell us about the mine?
^Went blind in that mine. So many lost canaries. Miracle I'm still alive!
^And what do I have to show for it? A pension? A house? Sure. But what else? I've lost everything.
^So easy to get lost in there. Just have to remember the passage.
^I need to sit down. Get out of here!
c-1: ^Can you tell us about the area?
^What about it? I don't know it.
^The state of my body I can't leave this house.
^Nothing around here anyway. Can't help you. Now get out!

MINE: ^An old brick mineshaft has punctured the ground and probes blindly into the sky. At the base, rubble fills up the doorway and mould grows over the chunks of rock and wood.
^It is dark, dank, dripping with water, decaying.

c-0: ^The wooden support structures are rotting and creak as you walk past.
^You seem to find yourself back at the crossroads at the entrance.
c-1: ^You seem to find yourself back at the crossroads at the entrance.
c-2: ^You seem to find yourself back at the crossroads at the entrance.

c-1: ^You pass a makeshift graveyard, with a miner's helmet atop each pile of dirt.

c-0: ^You enter a large section of cave with glistening ore, some pickaxes, and pleasant flourescent lighting from some luminescent mushrooms.

g-0: ^The action must have unstabled the mine - untouched for so long - and the roof caves in.
^You manage to escape, and head back to the car.

c-1: ^You seem to find yourself back at the crossroads at the entrance.

^You can't cross the barricade with your current team.

OBSERVATORY: ^Atop a snowcapped outcrop, an ancient observatory is built into the rock.
^The domed roof is closed, presumably due to the weather.

b: ^Great, seems as though you've sorted it out!
^I'll be able to get us past the static forcefield that protects the more delicate areas of the region.
^Hopefully the Static God will be on our side.
^You'll catch your death if you stay out there.
^I foresaw why you are here. And I will help you. Down with those fucking pigs.
^But I can't come with you yet, I am destined to watch over the three antennas in the nearby area.
^If you could just, like, drive around, find the three antennas and switch them onto standby...
^You'll have to like... hold on just write this down. West Yellow, North Blue, East Red. Simple.
^Go back down to the A7 and head West.

ANTENNA_1: ^A dark ash-grey antenna with a West facing satellite dish.
ANTENNA_2: ^A shiny silver antenna with a North facing satellite dish.
ANTENNA_3: ^A rusty orange antenna with an East facing satellite dish.
INTRO: ^The RESISTANCE is dwindling, and the last remaining members take refuge in an abandoned power station in the heart of the EXHAUSTLANDS.
^The FASCIST army moves closer everyday - unstoppable and hungry.
^Under the cold BROWNIE COVE sun, members of the Resistance journey out into the lands to explore the area, and prepare to do battle with the approaching DARKNESS.
^Space is running out, time is running out, faith is running out. But they can do this.
^Click and hold to drive. Find locations.
^Fill up at gas stations or services, change character selection at motels or services.
^Return to HQ when you believe you have enough faith to win.
ENDING: ^Do you believe you have enough faith?

b:
^And then the sky opens up.

^Just as the Darkness begins to get its claws into the Exhaustlands soil, light beams from cracks in the ground and the sky - piercing the formless shadow.

^Kapow!

^you win :)

^The Darkness finds its way into the Exhaustlands, shrivelling the world as if by an invisible wave pulling away a sandcastle.

^It consumes everything.

^You don't even have the chance to fight it.

^you lose :(

D1: ^You ever passed through here before? Like... before?

c-0: ^Before they closed the roads out of the Exhaustlands, right?
^That was a long long time ago, huh?
c-1: ^Hmmm. Long time ago they closed the roads out of the Exhaustlands, right?
g-0: ^Back when the train was running across the mountains?

D2: ^Out here where there's never anybody else around.

g-0: ^It's like... you could close your eyes... and you could be driving into deep space.
^We could be anywhere. Places no one has been before.
^It was some kind of screech. Or roar.
^I can't believe you didn't hear it. It felt like the sky was rattling.
^What is it? I've never seen anything like it.
^Inky tendrils feeling the sky like that. I can't bare to look at it.

c-0: ^Yes. I think we can do it.
^I've been feeling recently like... what is there to even fight for anymore? We've already lost it all.
^There's a feeling of darkness that I don't think will ever go away.
^But I still hope we win. Because fuck them.
c-1: ^No. It doesn't seem as though there is any hope left.
^But I don't think we can give up.
^Even if it brings about our end, we need to show that we are not gonna take this anymore.
^They need to know what they are doing is wrong.
